job_title: Dean of Nursing & Allied Health in Dowagiac, MI

pros: I enjoyed working with the students.
cons: The college treats its adjunct employees like second-class citizens. Pay breaks down to roughly $3 per hour when you factor in grading and class prep time. LOTS of nepotism and favoritism. So many good teachers with excellent credentials and high reviews were overlooked for promotions because the administration was a good ol boys club that worked under the laws of cronyism.

pros: Not to rowdy of a campus
cons: Can be a bit empty and lonely in the evenings

job_title: Business Instructor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Good Leadership and excellent team environment
cons: College recently unionized and may change work environment.

review_title: College run on part time staff
cons: Relies heavily on part-time staff and student workers which they seem to highlight as a positive when in actual fact, it just means more workers are underpaid and don't have benefits.

review_title: The experience has been rewarding and beneficial.
pros: I have completed my internship here at the college and have formed great relationships with the staff and members.
cons: The cons of working result from organizational issues that could easily be resolved. Other than that, the working conditions and people are great.

pros:
Beautiful campus
Great minds and colleagues - everyone seems to genuinely care about student success
Manageable paperwork requirements
Fun and relaxed environment that makes a difference for the area
Freedom to work on my own schedule 
Resources and manager available when needed
Continuing education available and encouraged
cons: None that I can think of

review_title: A perfect intro level position to develop my communications and sales experience.
pros: Opportunity for advancement and an excellent health benefits package. Opt out available as well. A community college that ensures a sense of belonging.
cons: The campus is located in an isolated area. High stress environment and must be willing to make personal sacrifices in order to be successful. Job requires work outside of the traditional 8-5 spectrum.

pros: Southwestern Michigan College offers core classes for nearly any degree, as well as health programs in nursing, physical therapy, and more.  Tuition is half the cost of most schools.  In addition, SMC offers housing (dorms) for a community college and a wide variety of campus life activities.
cons: Some students are not aware of or apathetic to the fantastic opportunities SMC offers.

review_title: They don't value their long time dedicated employees, the just want young employees.
pros: It's a great place to work for a few years, but don't plan on staying much longer than 5 years.
cons: Not having a strong supportive supervisor. Not feeling valued or care about. Experience is something that should mean something.

job_title: Marketing Analyst/Customer Relations Developer in Dowagiac, MI
pros: Great benefits and awesome retirement contribution. Free membership to the Student Activity Center.
cons: Advancement is based on friendships and who is close with senior leadership.

pros: Lots of great faculty and staff work there. Many go above and beyond for students.
cons: Upper admistration makes bias and unethcial choices. They will actively discrimate against students. They keep way too much informaton behind closed doors.

pros: No commute, got to be on computer while working, Netflix was allowed after midnight
cons: Not many hours available, people didn't show up to releave you

pros: Extremely flexible scheduling, friendly management, laid-back atmosphere
cons: There is no real advancement for student workers, in terms of promotion or pay.

pros: Great team-work environment, the faculty and staff really care about the students, and it is a rewarding position.
Great benefits and wonderful people to work with
cons: Sometimes communication between departments is a problem.

pros: flexibility, friendly staff, friendly students, organized
cons: There are no cons that I can think of

review_title: OK if you aren't very motivated
cons: Most of the people aren't very motivated
